conclusion: Violation of Art. 3;Not necessary to examine Art. 2;Not necessary to examine Art. 8;No violation of Art. 13;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
docname: CASE OF D. v. THE UNITED KINGDOM - [Russian Translation]
externalsources: United Nations Commission on Human Rights, resolution of 9 March 1993 on the protection of human rights in the context of human immunodeficiency virus or acquired immunodeficiency syndrome;Summit of Heads of Government or Representatives of forty-two States, declaration of 1 December 1994;WHO report on "Health conditions in the Americas", 1994, Volume II, concerning St Kitts and Nevis;Terrence Higgins Trust, "Treatment issues - a basic guide to medical treatment options for people with HIV and AIDS", April 1996
issue: Immigration Act 1971, Part 1, sections 3 (1) and 4 (1) ; Immigration and Nationality Department of the Home Office, policy document (BDI 3/95), August 1995, paras. 2, 4 and 5 ; Court of Appeal, R. v. Secretary of State for the Home Department, ex parte D., judgment of 15 February 1996
scl: Soering v. the United Kingdom judgment of 7 July 1989, Series A no. 161, pp. 47-48, paras. 120-124;Vilvarajah and Others v. the United Kingdom judgment of 30 October 1991, Series A no. 215, p. 39, paras. 122-123;Chahal v. the United Kingdom judgment of 15 November 1996, Reports 1996-V, p. 1853, paras. 73-74, p. 1871, para. 151;Ahmed v.
